tagline: Thorough, fair code review that catches bugs and raises the bar for the whole team
pros: Catches subtle bugs — race conditions, null refs, resource leaks — that automated tools miss
Categorized feedback (blocker/suggestion/nit) so authors know exactly what to fix
Cross-language fluency across Python, TypeScript, Go, Rust, Java, and Ruby
Turns reviews into teaching moments that level up the whole team
cons: Focused on review — won't write features or design systems from scratch
Thoroughness can feel slow on massive PRs — will push to decompose them first
Needs codebase context to give good architectural feedback — less effective cold

model_recommendations.notes: Solid reasoning + good writing. Benefits from thinking but doesn't need max reasoning. Best cost/capability balance.
